elements.2211.03234_5f312bff2a1dd5ba014d25ce2af3b: In this article, we propose a relativistic wave
elements.2211.03234_77fe4280b7eb8c87e457bbe4fe266: particle duality relation between the four-velocity of a particle and the spinor wave function, analogous to that in the pilot-wave interpretation of quantum mechanics
elements.2211.03234_4808514f5c5a29dac5296fe9add03: We demonstrate the validity of this relation for a free particle related to a plane wave in flat spacetime (section 2).
elements.2211.03234_88c00ec5ed7bdcbab6b3d56857e15: We use this relation to derive the Mathisson

elements.2211.03234_ea13ba37c08e8738c78b84344b7f8: momentum tensors for a spinor field, which satisfies the Dirac equation in a curved spacetime (section 3).

elements.2211.03234_ebc844775e4910789b047fc3b29f8: , in which the spacetime has both curvature and torsion
elements.2211.03234_74bc80bfbea8287f951e59c315773: We show that these equations reduce to the geodesic equation of motion, as in general relativity
elements.2211.03234_9809f706b28b6055a80458b06e202: Finally, we show how the relativistic wave
elements.2211.03234_df002b0fbf625bb2c6a90c8f03ef8: particle duality relation and the operator form of the Mathisson
elements.2211.03234_b50757f87e09ad48815ec3d28bf78: Papapetrou equations can be derived from the covariant Heisenberg equation of motion in the presence of torsion (section 4).
elements.2211.03234_dfe3cc30e52741810a648c3eea657: These results provide a further validation of the equivalence between the classical and quantum dynamics of massive spin-1/2 particles in the gravitational field and a general-relativistic generalization of the pilot-wave theory (briefly discussed in section 5).

elements.2211.03234_b691443154d86a589437b59b4bbc7: The Dirac equation is a relativistic wave equation, which describes all massive spin-1/2 particles such as electrons and quarks

elements.2211.03234_9058d19dd53ff62bda5dbfb8a2374: In this work, we proposed that the relativistic wave
elements.2211.03234_56e83bea903ee8d3d069e8de0990b: ) provides a general-relativistic generalization of the guiding equation in the pilot-wave interpretation of quantum mechanics
elements.2211.03234_5328dccd5f8ae99aedd48c26dac71: We showed the validity of this relation for a free particle related to a plane wave in flat spacetime
elements.2211.03234_90d55109280464026b4a04d88f9f4: We used this relation and the covariant conservation laws for the spin and energy
elements.2211.03234_8df550430de8b30c2ec1326bb759c: momentum tensors to show that if a spinor wave function satisfies the Dirac equation in spacetime with curvature and torsion, then the corresponding particle satisfies the Mathisson
elements.2211.03234_571e6586f1ef7c62208ac624787ec: Papapetrou equations, which reduce to the geodesic equation of motion
elements.2211.03234_5b03763f2e43e589c2af8bc2ee186: We also showed that the operator form of these equations and the duality relation can be derived from the Heisenberg equation of motion with the covariant derivative with respect to the proper time, extending the work of Wong
elements.2211.03234_7c4a81b684ae5d76b3b228bd98e03: All these novel results give a further validation of the equivalence between the classical and quantum dynamics of massive spin-1/2 particles in the gravitational field.
